title: Rozenburg (island)
text:
Rozenburg is an island in the western <a href="Netherlands">Netherlands</a>, in the province of <a href="South%20Holland">South Holland</a>. Rozenburg Island was formed centuries ago from several sand bars in the <a href="Meuse">Meuse</a> <a href="estuary">estuary</a>. In 1568, construction started on the first set of <a href="dike%20%28construction%29">dikes</a> and in 1586 the land known as "Roosenburgh" was leased to Dirk Ariensz. Bisdommer and Son, the first permanent inhabitant of Rozenburg.
In 1950, the stretch of the <a href="Nieuwe%20Maas">Nieuwe Maas</a> river south of Rozenburg (also locally called Brielse Maas) was dammed off at both ends of Rozenburg Island, thereby forming <a href="Brielse%20Meer">Brielse Meer</a> and connecting it to <a href="Voorne-Putten">Voorne-Putten</a> Island.
Beginning in the same period, most of the island was given over to <a href="Industrial%20sector">industrial</a> <a href="Business">enterprise</a>, part of the <a href="Port%20of%20Rotterdam">Port of Rotterdam</a> (<a href="Botlek">Botlek</a> and <a href="Europoort">Europoort</a>). When these sea ports were being planned in the 1950s, the councils of <a href="Rotterdam">Rotterdam</a> and Rozenburg made the arrangement that Rotterdam would lead the development of the ports and industry, while Rozenburg would look after the housing of the expected population increase. The village of Blankenburg on the island had to be completely removed to make way for new canals and industry. The new housing developments were concentrated around the old village centre of Rozenburg on the <a href="Het%20Scheur">Scheur</a> branch. In a short period its population rose from 3,500 to over 14,000.
